My Creative Process

All of my web development projects are based off of a practiced formula to get the result that I'm looking for.

1

Discuss Project with Clients

I begin by talking to the client and getting a very detail-oriented idea of what features they wish to have on their application. I discuss pricing, packaging, and ensure that we're a good fit and will work well together.

2

Brainstorming & Concept

This portion of the creative process includes determining what technologies will work best for the project, flowcharting, and bouncing ideas off of my team. Once we have a gameplan in place, I bring the concept back to the client for confirmation.

3

Write Quality Code

Finally, I write clean, quality code in best practice to ensure functionality far into the future. During this step in my process, I keep the client updated with my progress to ensure I can implement any last-minute features or design changes.

4

Client Presentation

Whenever I have a product that I feel is completed, I present it back to the client. If they like it, we're done! If not, I bring it back to the drawing board and figure out how to change the code or implement features to make the client happy with the product.
